project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
running JIRA : v6.0.6#6105-sha1:9713ad1
running Crucible : Version:2.7.11 Build:20120227023831 2012-02-27

An issue is created under a project ABC. Work is done on ABC-1222 for 2 months. Source tab tracks Subversion changes indexed by Crucible.
Mid-way project XYZ is created. ABC-1222 is converted to XYZ-88. Source tab now shows history committed when issue was ABC-1222, however the issues list is no longer sorted. (previously sorted descending by date/time)

We checked other ABC-#### issues that had not converted or previously closed, the sorting is correct (descending). (This also resolved that the crucible dB may need re-index)
fields.summary: Jira issue source tab items are unsorted when issue is renamed to a new project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+ # enable Perforce Job Integration in JIRA # create a multi-line text field in JIRA # create a Job Checkbox custom field (in JIRA) for Perforce # put these fields on Create Issue screen # follow [this|http://www.perforce.com/perforce/doc.current/manuals/p4sag/chapter.jobspecs.html] to add a new field to Perforce jobs # edit Perforce Job Integration -> Map Custom Fields and map the multi-line text field (step 2) to the Perforce field (step 5) # create a new JIRA issue and tick Yes at the Job Checkbox field (step 3) to have it duplicated as a Perforce job # also enter several lines into the multi-line text field e.g.: {code} FirstLine SecondLine ThirdLine {code} # click Create h4. +Expected behavior+ The JIRA issue is duplicated as a Perforce job with the correct field mappings h4. +Actual behavior+ A Perforce job is not created because of this error in JIRA log: {code} 2015-03-12 21:58:29,401 http-bio-2768-exec-18 ERROR admin 1318x2636x1 jku0d9 192.168.1.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [com.perforce.api.Debug] P4 exited with an Error! 2015-03-12 21:58:29,402 http-bio-2768-exec-18 ERROR admin 1318x2636x1 jku0d9 192.168.1.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [jirafisheyeplugin.perforce.listener.JobUpdateListener] Could not commit job: Job: DEMO-17 User: admin Description: Test com.perforce.api.CommitException at com.perforce.api.Job.commit(Job.java:365) at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.perforce.listener.JobUpdateListener.createJob(JobUpdateListener.java:42) at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.perforce.listener.JobUpdateListener.workflowEvent(JobUpdateListener.java:30) ... Caused by: java.io.IOException: error: Error in job specification.error: Error detected at line 11.error: Syntax error in 'SecondLine'. at com.perforce.api.P4Process.closeProcess(P4Process.java:587) at com.perforce.api.Job.commit(Job.java:361) ... 226 more {code} h4. +Note+ * If only 1 line is entered into the text field, a Perforce job is created successfully * In Perforce, multiple lines can be manually entered into the same field * It doesn't matter whether the multi-line text field in JIRA uses Default Text or Wiki Style renderer h4. +Workaround+ Using HTML tag {{
}} to indicate new lines works. For example, using this single line in the multi-line text field: {code}FirstLine
SecondLine
ThirdLine{code} * It appears as a single line, thus it works * In Perforce, the field is rendered correctly with separate lines
fields.summary: Syntax error when mapping multi-line text field from JIRA to Perforce

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a non-admin user clicks the "Hide this tab" link on a FishEye/Crucible ad, it attempts to navigate to websudo screens, prompting the non-admin to enter the password to perform an administrative action.

For more details please look at Fisheye issue FISH-569 (https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/FISH-569)

Video clipping can be found here -> http://screencast.com/t/pnqJeG7jxr
fields.summary: Non-Admin users cannot hide the SOURCE and REVIEW tabs in a JIRA issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a customer has created a new project or yet to add components from the main project view, clicking the 'Learn More' link loads a 'Project is Unavailable' page as the URL is linking to the following page: 'https://beherenow.atlassian.net/projects/undefined'

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA Agile v1000.0.9-D20160627T082418


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project or select a project that has no components added
# View the project from the Backlog view
# Click the Components link in the left hand menu (sidebar)
# Click the 'Learn More' link


h3. Expected Results
The link should load the JIRA Server URL
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-components-802592503.html

or

The link should load the JIRA Cloud URL
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Managing+components


h3. Actual Results
A page stating 'This project isn't available' is displayed


h3.Workaround
If a customer wishes to read about components for the time being, he/she can use the following links:

JIRA Server
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-components-802592503.html

JIRA Cloud
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Managing+components
fields.summary: Clicking Learn More on components page results in This project isn't available page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, there is no feature to configure Create Branch menu to be available for certain project

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to configure "Create Branch" option to be available for certain project
fields.summary: Having the option to configure "Create Branch" option to be available for certain project

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# This was reproduced with the Tempo AccountCustomField, which was added to the Issue Detail View.
# Attempt to access the Board Configuration.

The configuration page loads, however an error is reported.

{noformat}

h3. Workaround

# Identify the problematic custom field - in this scenario it was done with the following:
{noformat}
select * from customfield where customfieldtypekey like '%account%';
-[ RECORD 1 ]----------+-----------------------------------------------------------
id                     | 14330
customfieldtypekey     | com.tempoplugin.tempo-accounts:accounts.customfield
customfieldsearcherkey | com.tempoplugin.tempo-accounts:accounts.searcher
cfname                 | Account
description            | xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xx xxxxxxxx
defaultvalue           |
fieldtype              |
project                |
issuetype              |
{noformat}
# Disable the affected plugin (in this case, Tempo Accounts).
# Browse to the Issue Detail View of the affected board.
# Remove the Custom Field with a warning icon (!) that has the id from above (in this case, 14330).
# Re-enable the plugin and verify the board configuration can be viewed.

If unsure which plugin the field belongs to, it's possible to enable Safe Mode in the Add-on Manager and then re-enable Agile / Software after, then browse to the board to find the ids. You can then check the database with the SQL from step 1 to see if that field is possibly affected.

Also to verify which boards have that field in the issue detail view we can use the below SQL:

{code:SQL}
select * from "AO_60DB71_DETAILVIEWFIELD" where "FIELD_ID" = 'customfield_14330';
{code}
fields.summary: Board configuration returns a blank screen if an unsupported Custom Field is in the Issue Detail View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing the Board Configuration page, JIRA Software makes a call to {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/editmodel.json}}. In this particular problem that call returns a HTTP 500 as an exception is thrown when looking up all available statuses in all workflows to determine which should be mapped to the status columns in the board configuration.

This is caused by a workflow with an orphaned status and is very similar to JSW-11487, however occurs on versions later than 6.7.0.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a workflow with an orphaned status (ie delete the status from the DB after creating the workflow).
# Access the board configuration page.

h3. Expected Results

It handles the null without failure.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown and board rendering fails:

h3. Workaround

The workaround is similar to [Internal Server Error when accessing Rapid board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Internal+Server+Error+when+accessing+Rapid+board], however this can be caused by any workflow (not just those used by the board).
fields.summary: Board Configuration returns a blank screen if JIRA has a workflow with a missing status

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Venezuela recently switched their timezone offset from GMT-4:30 to GMT-4. JIRA will need to have the timezone updated to use the new offset.

{quote}
Venezuela uses the UTC−04:00 time offset, and they had previously used UTC−04:30 from December 9, 2007 until April 30, 2016.
{quote}

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_in_Venezuela

h3. Environment 
*  Effects Cloud - version 1000.110.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set JIRA User profile to use Caracas time zone

h3. Expected Results

* Timezone off-set should be GMT-04:00

h3. Actual Results

* Timezone off-set is set to GMT-04:30
 
h3.Workaround
Select another timezone that's currently in GMT-04:00 such as Antigua

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Background*
I have a Scrum Board, and a Kanban Board.

I use the Kanban Board for Business Features, to separate stakeholders from feeling like editing tasks.  We use Epics in this view, one per business feature.

The engineering team pulls these into their own Scrum Board by creating a new epic on their board with the same name and linking to the Kanban epic for visibility.  The team is empowered to pull off the kanban as they wish, and create their own tasks.

For visibility, we want the Kanban Epics linked to the Scrum Epics. 

The workflow is a bit cumbersome

*Problem*
 It is a huge pain to manually link (click the epic in Scrum Board, click More, click Link, etc...  too many steps, and the server response is slow between each).

Also, when under Link, it is unreliable, I start typing my epic title, and it doesn't show, I have to type the ID for the epic most of the time (PRO-24).  This is a huge pain. 

*Solution*
It would be nice to drag an epic from one board to another board's epic, to create the link (or right click link, then drag to the other browser window's epic to link it...)....   

An alternative that would work for us would be ability to auto mirror kanban epics upon creation to a Scrum Board.  I also looked for Bulk Copy but it didn't seem to exist.

Another alternative would be a kanban view for Epic viewing / editing, in the individual Scrum Board.  Then we could eliminate a level.  Though it is nice to have multiple teams (and multiple Scrum Boards) all linking to the same Kanban, so....  Not sure this is a flexible solution (perhaps it's a separate nice-to-have independent of this request).
fields.summary: Fast drag & drop linking from issue in one project to issue in another project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JIRA 7, if a user using German language went to Lexorank Management page, he/she will see the following warning:

{quote}Benutzer können die Rangfolge von Vorgängen nicht aufrufen oder ändern, da dieser JIRA-Instanz keine gültige JIRA Software-Lizenz zugewiesen ist. Keine Sorge. Ihren Vorgängen wird bei der Erstellung weiterhin automatisch ein Rang zugewiesen. Wenn Sie die Rangfolgefunktion für Vorgänge wieder für Ihre Benutzer verfügbar machen möchten, fügen Sie eine gültige JIRA Software-Lizenz hinzu. Alternativ dazu können Sie JIRA Software deaktivieren, wenn Ihren Vorgängen kein Rang mehr zugewiesen werden soll.{quote}

Translation:

{quote}Users can not access or change the ranking of operations, since this JIRA instance is assigned a valid JIRA software license. Do not worry. Your processes will continue to be automatically assigned a rank in the creation. If you want to make the ranking function for operations available to your users again, add a valid JIRA software license. Alternatively, you can disable JIRA software, if your operations no more rank to be assigned.{quote}

Even though the warning is shown, all the ranking features works well and no error is shown in the Lexorank Management page.

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.0.5, 7.0.10, 7.1.8

h3. Expected Results

Instead of the warning above, the following message should be shown:

{quote}The LexoRank system is part of JIRA Software. If you have never used JIRA Software before, you won't need to configure anything on this screen. Otherwise, you can manage the ordering of issues via this screen, but we recommend that you contact our support team before doing so.{quote}

h3. Actual Results

Following warning is shown:

{quote}Benutzer können die Rangfolge von Vorgängen nicht aufrufen oder ändern, da dieser JIRA-Instanz keine gültige JIRA Software-Lizenz zugewiesen ist. Keine Sorge. Ihren Vorgängen wird bei der Erstellung weiterhin automatisch ein Rang zugewiesen. Wenn Sie die Rangfolgefunktion für Vorgänge wieder für Ihre Benutzer verfügbar machen möchten, fügen Sie eine gültige JIRA Software-Lizenz hinzu. Alternativ dazu können Sie JIRA Software deaktivieren, wenn Ihren Vorgängen kein Rang mehr zugewiesen werden soll.{quote}

h3.Workaround

# Request user to use English language
# Ignore the warning since the ranking functions works fine even though the warning is shown
fields.summary: Lexorank Management Page Warning

\\

The last sentence of #2 is my recommendation / feature request...

Thanks for a great product :) \\
\\
----
\\

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13819].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Create Kanban board
# Create Issue AAA
# Create subtask to this issue called BBB
# Using the Board, Move both parent and subtask to be the "In Progress" state
# drag parent issue, AAA, to Done column
# Click "Release..." to create a new release and clear the current done issues from this board
# Drag subtask BBB over to Done state

This creates a popup requesting you to update parent or cancel.

Expected result:
Clicking update should try to update the parent status and then finish

Actual result:
clicking update button only causes the popup to reappear again immediately.  This popup stays until you select cancel.

Workaround:
This only occurs when using the kanban board to drag this issue to this state.  If you edit the subtask to select the transition, this popup never occurs.


Note:
Since the parent issue is already resolved, I don't think this popup should be seen at all.  And if it is, then clicking the update button should complete that task and then close.
fields.summary: subtask popup to update parent issue caught in loop when parent issue close/removed from board

h3. Summary
When JIRA Calendar gadget is based on a custom field (Date time type) with default date set as DD-MM-YYYY 12:00 am, then the data in the gadget does not show correctly.


h3. Environment
* Custom field of type 'Date Time Picker' with default value set at 12:00 am for example : '13/Jun/16 12:00 AM'
* JIRA Calendar gadget based in that custom field on the dashboard. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With the above environment setup, create issues for the next day at 12:am for example : '14/Jun/16 12:00 AM'.
# Refresh the gadget on the dashboard

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should show the issue on the correct date.

h3. Actual Results
# The gadget now shows the issue on both dates : '13/Jun/16' as well as '14/Jun/16'
# Click on the number on the gadget, notice that the number on issue navigator is different than the number on the gadget.

 
h3. Notes
On Issue Navigator, notice that the query is : 
{{project = 10000 AND cf[10000] >= 2016-06-13 AND cf[10000] <= 2016-06-14}}

whereas, the query should be like 
{{project = 10000 AND cf[10000] >= 2016-06-13 AND cf[10000] < 2016-06-14}}

h3.Workaround
Changing the custom field default time to something other than 12:00 am should also work around this problem.

fields.description:
If you link a Bitbucket repository to a project, create an issue, then commit some changesets against an issue, the changesets show up on the Development sidebar gadget.

This is working as expected, however, if you then delete the repository, the changesets remain against the JIRA issue and you end up with a bunch of 404 links to changesets that no longer exist.

Further, if you permanently delete the JIRA project (so the project KEY becomes available again), then open a new project with the same KEY, then start a new issue with the same code (eg. KEY-1), it seems any old changesets from the deleted repository will also show up against the new issue.

Since neither the original project or the original repository exist any more, this is clearly wrong and the association is misleading on the Issue (in some cases it might be totally confusing!)

I wasn't 100% sure whether to raise this against JIRA core or the DCVS connector... sorry about that!
fields.summary: JIRA issues can link to 404 changesets on deleted repositories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
This is related to performance problem described in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-13211. A JIRA system has a maximum throughput of JQL's depending on the number of cores etc, DB, index etc. Kanban boards have a "JQL load score" (_JQL complexity_) based on the complexity of the query and the multipliers created by swimlanes+colours.
A system can become overloaded if too many Kanban boards with a high "JQL load score" are loaded in a short interval.

h3. Suggested Solution
The system performance can be maintained if users that create boards are advised of their "JQL load score".

h3. Workaround 
Parse access log for slow requests and then review related Kanban boards
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to show to users JQL complexity of the Kanban boards

fields.description:
{panel:title=Original description}
Currently, if any issues in Sprint A in one board (Board A) got moved to Sprint B in another board (Board B), Sprint B will show up in the Velocity Report of Board A.

It would be nice to limit sprints within a board in the Velocity Report, so no other sprints belonging to other boards should show up in the report.
{panel}

h3. Summary
Velocity Report includes Sprints from other Boards.

h3. Environment
 * 2016-01-18 Cloud, 2016-02-01 Cloud, 1000.383.2 Cloud
 * JIRA 7.x Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h4. +Scenario 1+
 * You have Board A with filter "project = A". You have Sprint A with issue A-1, A-2 inside it. Sprint A has to be a *future* Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.
 * You have Board B with filter "project = B". You have Sprint B with issue B-1, B-2 inside it. Sprint B has to be a *future* Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.

If issue A-1 is moved to Sprint B, it means that Sprint B will contain 1 issue that matches the filter of Board A, thus Sprint B will APPEAR in Board A. If that happens then the Velocity Report of Board A will include Sprint B too.

h4. +Scenario 2+
 * You have Board A with filter "project = A". You have Sprint A with issue A-1, A-2 inside it. Sprint A is a *completed* Sprint.
 * You have Board B with filter "project = B".

There are also other scenarios that don't rely on the issue being moved from project to project, as long as the following conditions are met the bug will surface:
# The issue contains another sprint in the customfieldvalue
# the issue contains another sprint in the history of the issue (i.e. it has an entry in changeitem). 

h4. +Scenario 3+
You have multiple boards that have filters wide enough to pull in issues for multiple boards, the issues do not need to have been moved from project to project
h4. +Scenario 4+
At one point one the issue was part of another sprint in another board and the sprint was started. The issue is then moved from an open or closed sprint to a new sprint, this will cause the same behavior in the Velocity report regardless of whether or not the issue was moved from project to project. 

h3. Expected Results
* Velocity Report should only show sprints from other boards if the issues were moved between active sprints, not in planning phase (between future sprints).
** As moving issues to-from sprints affects velocity (committed/completed), the report should show it accordingly.
* Velocity Report should not include completed sprints from other boards, as they were not committed/completed in the current board.

h3. Actual Results
Velocity Report includes sprints outside the scope of the board, and sprints might result empty:
!velocity.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
For Scenario 2, board admin may:
# Reopen Sprint A from Board B's Sprint Report
# Remove issue B-1 (formerly A-1) from Sprint A
# Complete Sprint A

In this case, Sprint A doesn't contain anything related to Board B at all, but:
# It's still included in Board B's Velocity Report (as an empty sprint)
# It disappears from Board B's Sprint Report

h2. Workaround: 
There is no current workaround for this bug
fields.summary: Velocity report should only show sprints related to the current board

fields.description:
The date and time format used by JIRA is wrong and confusing.

When starting a Sprint in JIRA Agile, it prompts you to input date and time format as follows:

17/Jun/16 05:00 PM

International and well recognised standards are to use either:

1. 12 hour format: 17/Jun/16 5:00 PM
or 
2. 24 hour format: 17/Jun/16 17:00

The current approach is a blend of 12 and 24 hour format and incorrect.  In the example, above, when *05:00* is specified (using a leading zero) by definition this means 5:00 AM not PM.

Please could you correct your use of date and time formats to be consistent with international standards and common usage.
fields.summary: Correct Date and Time format

h3. Summary

Whenever user uses a third-party plugin to create several subtasks during workflow operation (for example ScriptRunner) JIRA Software's ranking system, LexoRank, will deadlock if those workflow operation being performed on two (or more) issues at the same time.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Let's say we want to create 5 subtasks during workflow transition.

Whenever sub-task is created LexorankIssueEvenListener is invoked and it performs initial ranking. During that ranking, LexoRankOperation goes into synchronized block and acquires a lock in database by performing an update over several rows in lexorank table. Due to transaction opened by workflow from now on lexorank table (or desired set of records) is locked until transaction is completed. After that LexoRankOperation completes for first subtask and returns control to workflow. It is ready to create second subtask.

At the same time another thread performs creation of 5 subtasks for another issue through same workflow operation. That thread goes into synchronized block and tries to acquire lock in database:
{code:java}
synchronized (rankFieldIdLocks.get(rankFieldId))
            {
                // find new available entity
                LexoRankRow[] unlockedRankRows = dao.getMaximumMarkerRowAndPreviousRow(rankFieldId);
                LockOutcome lockOutcome = dao.acquireLock(unlockedRankRows);



{code}
It stuck here because to acquire that lock it needs to update lexorank table which is locked in another transaction. So it waits for exclusive lock in database and holds lock in java.

At the same time first thread with workflow operation ready to create second subtask. It creates it and invokes LexoRankIssueEventListener which tries to perform initial ranking. it goes to rankInitially() method and stuck there waiting for possibility to acquire a lock to enter synchronized block.

So we have second thread waiting for lock in database and holding a lock in java and we have first thread waiting for lock in java and holding lock in database. Then somebody trying to perform workflow operation on third issue.... Eventually, jira hangs.
h3. Expected Results

Workflow creation works fine. JIRA is stable.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA hangs and the following error is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log:
{code:java}
2016-08-27 12:49:57,057 http-nio-127.0.0.101-8080-exec-109 ERROR username 940x1974177x4 1no823r 127.0.0.1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [c.a.g.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl] Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction
com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLTransactionRollbackException: Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method) 

{code}
h3. Workaround

Disable third-party plugin subtasks creation or follow steps from one of the comments below for Script Runner plugin.
 * This has also been found to occur with the Create on Transition for JIRA plugin
fields.summary: Third-party apps that create multiple subtasks as part of workflow operations may trigger LexoRank deadlocks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA is configured using our documentation to use a keystoreFile an exception occurs and the gadget is not rendered.

This is happening because the gadget looks in the JDK truststore (cacerts) to locate the certificate, ignoring the configured Tomcat keystore location.

This primarily affects self-signed certificates certificates signed by an authority that is not distributed with the JDK.

h3. Environment

Reproduced the defect with...
* (/) JIRA 6.3.15 with JIRA Agile 6.7.12
* (/) JIRA 6.4.13 with JIRA Agile 6.7.14
* (/) JIRA Software 7.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA
# Install a self-signed certificate using the instructions at [Running JIRA applications over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Running+JIRA+applications+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]
#* Note: Create your own .jks keystore for use by JIRA, that's the point of failure.
# Attempt to add the "Agile Version Report" gadget to a Dashboard

h3. Expected Results

The gadget should be shown successfully.

h3. Actual Results

An error message is shown, "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource."
!AgileVersionReport-broken.png|thumbnail!

SSL exceptions appear in the server logs. The stack trace is different for each JIRA version.

See [^stacktrace-JIRA063.txt] for the full trace:
{code:borderStyle=solid|title=Stacktrace JIRA 6.3}
2016-06-06 10:58:43,327 http-bio-8583-exec-21 ERROR admin 658x155x1 1738vzj 127.0.0.1 /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest [renderer.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher] Unable to retrieve response
javax.net.ssl.SSLPeerUnverifiedException: peer not authenticated
{code}

See [^stacktrace-JIRA064.txt] for the full trace:
{code:borderStyle=solid|title=Stacktrace JIRA 6.4}
2016-06-06 13:27:55,333 http-bio-8583-exec-8 uri:/djira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest username:admin ERROR admin 807x186x1 1y3c6n6 127.0.0.1 /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest [renderer.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher] Unable to retrieve response
javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: No appropriate protocol (protocol is disabled or cipher suites are inappropriate)
{code}

See [^stacktrace-JIRA071.txt] for the full trace:
{code:borderStyle=solid|Stacktrace JIRA 7.1}
2016-06-06 13:39:31,533 http-bio-8583-exec-12 ERROR admin 819x308x1 17v3ipr 127.0.0.1 /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest [c.a.g.r.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher] Unable to retrieve response
javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target
{code}


h3. Notes

* [Testing with SSLPoke|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/Unable+to+Connect+to+SSL+Services+due+to+PKIX+Path+Building+Failed] and [httpclienttest|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/httpclienttest] both result in a successful connection.
* JIRA itself and all other Agile/Software gadgets are unaffected.

h3. Workaround

Import the self-signed cert into the cacerts trust store _for the JDK_.

{code:borderStyle=solid}
sudo $JAVA_HOME/bin/keytool -import -alias <YOUR_CERTIFICATE_ALIAS> -keystore $JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/security/cacerts -file <PATH_TO_YOUR_CRT_FILE>
{code}

Alternively this can be done using [Portecle|http://portecle.sourceforge.net/]:
# Now run Portecle as an Administrator user on the OS
# Open the JDK cacerts file from C:\Jira\Program\jre\lib\security\cacerts
# Select "Tools > Import Trusted Certificate..." in the menu
# Find and import the certificate you exported previously.
# Save the cacerts keystore and quit Portecle.
# Restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Agile Version Report is broken when using a keystoreFile outside the JDK

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Commits do not show in the Development Panel if the Issue Key is mentioned more than once in a commit message

h3. Environment
* Development Integration Plugin 3.3.25
* FishEye 3.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Assuming the issue key is KEY-123
# Commit in the repository with a message such as: "KEY-123 - KEY-123 code changes"
# In FishEye, the commit will be listed normally
# In JIRA, the development panel in the view issue page will not show this particular commit

h3. Expected Results
The commit should be listed in development panel even if the issue key is mentioned twice in the message

h3. Actual Results
The commit is not listed in the development panel

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Commits do not show in the Development Panel if the Issue Key is mentioned more than once in a commit message

fields.description:
Similar to JSW-5720 I'd like to see an option to create swim-lanes based on component.

The current method we use is to use the query filter and create a swimlane for each component.

Having this done automatically  would reduce the effort to initially configure kanban boards and future proof them in the event new components are added to the system.

The difficulty in implementing this is that an issue may belong to multiple components, and this  may render the board difficult to read. If you decide to watch this issue please post any suggestions on how this may be best visualized.
fields.summary: Add a new swimlane based on components for Kanban boards to reduce effort to setup and maintain boards

fields.description:
Our jira suffers from a bug that resets the issue type schemes of a lot of projects to the default one. After consulting with the support (https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/22/JSP-268659) i was able to find out the root cause: a dangerous DELETE.. WHERE ... statement:

{code}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Generic Entity Exception occurred in deleteByAnd (SQL Exception while executing the following:DELETE FROM configurationcontext WHERE FIELDCONFIGSCHEME=? (Deletion from CONFIGURATIONCONTEXT is forbidden!!!))

    com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Generic Entity Exception occurred in deleteByAnd (SQL Exception while executing the following:DELETE FROM configurationcontext WHERE FIELDCONFIGSCHEME=? (Deletion from CONFIGURATIONCONTEXT is forbidden!!!))
    	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.removeByAnd(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:305)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.removeByAnd(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:157)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.FieldConfigContextPersisterImpl.removeContextsForConfigScheme(FieldConfigContextPersisterImpl.java:89)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.removeContextsForConfigScheme(CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.java:122)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.updateFieldConfigScheme(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:242)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuetypes.pro.AssociateIssueTypeSchemes.run(AssociateIssueTypeSchemes.java:134)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuetypes.pro.AssociateIssueTypeSchemes.doExecute(AssociateIssueTypeSchemes.java:110)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuetypes.pro.SelectIssueTypeSchemeForProject.doExecute(SelectIssueTypeSchemeForProject.java:204)
    	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
....
{code}

Please note the WHERE clause - it will deleted all issue type associations that share the same issue type scheme. The "..forbidden.."  message is from the trigger I created in order to debug the issue:

{code}
create trigger CONF_CONTEXT_GUARDIAN
on CONFIGURATIONCONTEXT for delete as
begin 
	rollback transaction
	raiserror 17000 'Deletion from CONFIGURATIONCONTEXT is forbidden!!!'
end
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA generates dangerous DELETE FROM CONFIGURATIONCONTEXT WHERE... clause

fields.description:
When generating a version report within JIRA Agile 6.7.2 (and at least 6.7.12), within environments with large datasets, the version report chart does not correctly estimate completion dates.  In this case all three of those dates (optimistic, normal, and pessimistic) estimates can end up being listed on the same day.  Furthermore, these dates seem to be cutoff on the far right, instead of reaching the y-axis

It seems that the algorithm which prepares the series of data for predictions on chart does not take into account that there might be non-working days.

 !versionreportbad.png|thumbnail! 



Workaround:

* Click "Board" in top right corner
* Click "Configure" in drop-down menu
* Navigate to "Working Days" in the menu on the left
* Select all days as working.
* Navigate back to report

With work-around enabled, now report shows proper dates for predictions.

 !versionreportgood.png|thumbnail! 

This happens because predictions was made with non-working dates taken into account, but algorithm which generates series for chart does not take non-working days into account so it finishes chart earlier.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile version report does not correctly take into account non-working days

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to read Card Layouts via the JIRA Software REST API.

Being able to read the Card Layout from JIRA Software would more closely align Add-on Easy Agile User Story Maps with the JIRA Software layout users are used to.

We cannot currently retrieve the card layouts in JIRA Cloud as they are not available via the JIRA Software REST API
fields.summary: Expose Card Layout in the JIRA Software API
